title: Deuteronomy Chapter 10 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Deuteronomy chapter 10 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Deuteronomy Chapter 10 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Deuteronomy Chapter 10.

questions.question: What did the LORD instruct Moses to make according to Deuteronomy 10:1?
options: Two tables of stone and an ark of wood
questions.correctAnswer: Two tables of stone and an ark of wood
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 10:1 says the LORD told Moses to hew two tables of stone like the first and to make an ark of wood.

questions.question: Who died and was buried at Mosera as mentioned in Deuteronomy 10:6?
questions.correctAnswer: Aaron
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 10:6 states that Aaron died and was buried at Mosera.

questions.question: According to Deuteronomy 10:8, which tribe was separated to bear the ark of the covenant and minister before the LORD?
questions.correctAnswer: Levi
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 10:8 states that the LORD separated the tribe of Levi to bear the ark and minister before Him.

questions.question: How long did Moses stay on the mount the second time according to Deuteronomy 10:10?
questions.correctAnswer: Forty days and forty nights
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 10:10 says Moses stayed on the mount forty days and forty nights according to the first time.

questions.question: What does the LORD require of Israel as stated in Deuteronomy 10:12?
options: To fear the LORD, walk in His ways, love Him, and serve Him with all heart and soul
questions.correctAnswer: To fear the LORD, walk in His ways, love Him, and serve Him with all heart and soul
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 10:12 clearly states what the LORD requires: to fear Him, walk in His ways, love Him, and serve Him with all heart and soul.

questions.question: According to Deuteronomy 10:16, what are the Israelites commanded to circumcise?
questions.correctAnswer: The foreskin of their heart
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 10:16 commands circumcising the foreskin of the heart and to be no more stiffnecked.

questions.question: What title is given to the LORD in Deuteronomy 10:17?
options: God of gods, Lord of lords
questions.correctAnswer: God of gods, Lord of lords
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 10:17 describes the LORD as God of gods and Lord of lords.

questions.question: Who does the LORD execute judgment for, as mentioned in Deuteronomy 10:18?
questions.correctAnswer: The fatherless and widow
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 10:18 states God executes judgment for the fatherless and widow.

questions.question: Why are the Israelites commanded to love the stranger according to Deuteronomy 10:19?
options: Because they were strangers in the land of Egypt
questions.correctAnswer: Because they were strangers in the land of Egypt
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 10:19 instructs Israelites to love the stranger because they were once strangers in Egypt.

questions.question: What did the LORD swear to give to the fathers of Israel as told in Deuteronomy 10:11?
questions.correctAnswer: The land to possess
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 10:11 says the LORD commanded Moses to lead the people to possess the land sworn to their fathers.

questions.question: True or False: Deuteronomy 10:9 states that Levi has a portion and inheritance with his brethren.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 10:9 states that Levi has no part or inheritance with his brethren because the LORD is his inheritance.

questions.question: True or False: According to Deuteronomy 10:5, Moses put the tables of stone in the ark as the LORD commanded.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 10:5 confirms Moses put the tables in the ark as commanded by the LORD.

questions.question: True or False: Deuteronomy 10:21 says the LORD is the praise of Israel and has done great and terrible things.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 10:21 declares the LORD is Israel's praise and has done great and terrible things seen by their eyes.

questions.question: Complete this verse from Deuteronomy 10:14: 'Behold, the heaven and the heaven of heavens is the LORD'S thy God, the ______ also, with all that therein is.'
questions.correctAnswer: earth
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 10:14 states that the heaven and the heaven of heavens is the LORD's, and the earth also with all that therein is.

questions.question: Complete this verse from Deuteronomy 10:22: 'Thy fathers went down into Egypt with threescore and ten persons; and now the LORD thy God hath made thee as the ______ of heaven for multitude.'
questions.correctAnswer: stars
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 10:22 says the LORD made the people as the stars of heaven for multitude.

medium.title: Deuteronomy Chapter 10 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Deuteronomy Chapter 10 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling to maintain faith and obedience in difficult times. Based on Deuteronomy 10, what biblical truth would you share about God’s faithfulness and our response?
options: God hears our prayers and wants us to fear, love, and serve Him with all our heart and soul
God only helps those who are perfect and never sin
God expects us to handle difficulties without His help
God’s laws are optional for those who are faithful
questions.correctAnswer: God hears our prayers and wants us to fear, love, and serve Him with all our heart and soul
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 10:10-13 show that God hearkened to Moses' prayer and commands Israel to fear, love, and serve Him wholeheartedly. This teaches us God’s faithfulness and how we should respond with devotion and obedience.

questions.question: How does Deuteronomy 10 teach about humility and contentment in regard to our position among people?
options: God is the inheritance and portion for the tribe of Levi, not material possessions
Pride is the best way to gain God’s favor
Material wealth is the ultimate blessing from God
God only blesses those with many possessions
questions.correctAnswer: God is the inheritance and portion for the tribe of Levi, not material possessions
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 10:8-9 explains that Levi has no land inheritance because the LORD Himself is their inheritance, teaching that spiritual blessings and God’s presence are more important than material wealth.

questions.question: A church member struggles with bitterness and resentment. What principle from Deuteronomy 10 can help them find forgiveness and love toward others?
options: Love the stranger because you were once strangers in Egypt
Only love those who love you back
Forgiveness is not necessary for holiness
questions.correctAnswer: Love the stranger because you were once strangers in Egypt
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 10:18-19 teaches loving the stranger because Israel was once strangers in Egypt, encouraging believers to show love and forgiveness based on God's compassionate example.

questions.question: In what way does Deuteronomy 10 emphasize the importance of spiritual discipline and personal devotion?
options: Circumcise the foreskin of your heart and be no more stiffnecked
Only external rituals matter to God
Ignoring God’s commands is acceptable if we feel guilty
Spiritual growth happens without any effort
questions.correctAnswer: Circumcise the foreskin of your heart and be no more stiffnecked
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 10:16 calls for a heartfelt change, symbolized by circumcising the heart, meaning true devotion and obedience come from within, not just outward actions.

questions.question: Based on Deuteronomy 10, what should motivate believers to serve God with all their heart and soul?
options: God’s great power and the mighty works He has done for His people
To earn God’s favor by works alone
questions.correctAnswer: God’s great power and the mighty works He has done for His people
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 10:20-21 reminds believers to serve God because He is mighty and has done great and terrible things for His people, motivating wholehearted service.

questions.question: How does Deuteronomy 10 instruct believers to deal with temptation and trials?
options: Trust that God listens and will not destroy His people if they repent
Give into temptation when it’s too strong
Ignore God in times of trouble
Rely only on personal strength without prayer
questions.correctAnswer: Trust that God listens and will not destroy His people if they repent
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 10:10 shows Moses stayed 40 days and nights on the mountain and the LORD hearkened to him, indicating God listens in times of need and shows mercy when we seek Him.

questions.question: What biblical principle about integrity and obedience is highlighted in God’s command to Israel in Deuteronomy 10?
options: Keep the commandments and statutes for your own good
Obedience is optional if you feel like it
God’s laws are only for priests
You can choose which commandments to follow
questions.correctAnswer: Keep the commandments and statutes for your own good
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 10:13 teaches that keeping God’s commandments and statutes is commanded for the good of the people, emphasizing integrity and obedience for their benefit.

questions.question: What does Deuteronomy 10 reveal about God’s impartiality and justice?
options: God does not regard persons nor take bribes
God favors the rich and powerful
God’s judgment can be bought with gifts
God is partial to one nation only
questions.correctAnswer: God does not regard persons nor take bribes
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 10:17 states that God is great and mighty and does not take reward or show partiality, teaching believers to trust in His just and unbiased nature.

questions.question: A believer is discouraged about their small beginnings in faith. What encouragement from Deuteronomy 10 can you share?
options: From a small number, God made Israel as numerous as the stars of heaven
Only those born into faith are blessed
Growth depends solely on human effort
Size or number is insignificant to God
questions.correctAnswer: From a small number, God made Israel as numerous as the stars of heaven
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 10:22 reminds that Israel started with seventy persons but God multiplied them as stars of heaven, encouraging believers that God can grow small beginnings into great blessings.

questions.question: True or False: According to Deuteronomy 10, God commanded Moses to make a new ark and tables of stone identical to the first ones broken by Moses.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 10:1-3 describes how the LORD commanded Moses to hew two tables of stone like the first and make an ark of wood to put them in, confirming the command.

questions.question: True or False: Deuteronomy 10 teaches that God’s primary requirement of Israel is to fear Him, walk in His ways, love Him, and serve Him with all heart and soul.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 10:12 clearly states what the LORD requires of Israel, emphasizing wholehearted fear, love, and service to God as foundational duties.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Deuteronomy 10 teaches that the LORD executes the judgment of the __________ and widow, and loves the stranger, giving him food and raiment.
questions.correctAnswer: fatherless
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 10:18 states that the LORD executes judgment for the fatherless and widow, showing His care for vulnerable people and calling believers to reflect this love.

questions.question: How does Deuteronomy 10 describe the attitude believers should have toward God’s name and presence?
options: Fear the LORD, serve Him, cleave to Him, and swear by His name
Treat God’s name casually as any other
questions.correctAnswer: Fear the LORD, serve Him, cleave to Him, and swear by His name
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 10:20 instructs Israel to fear the LORD, serve Him, cleave to Him, and swear by His name, underscoring reverence and commitment in relationship with God.

questions.question: What example from Deuteronomy 10 teaches believers about perseverance in prayer and seeking God’s mercy?
options: Moses stayed on the mount 40 days and nights and the LORD hearkened to him
Moses gave up after a day of prayer
questions.correctAnswer: Moses stayed on the mount 40 days and nights and the LORD hearkened to him
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 10:10 shows Moses’ perseverance in prayer leading to God’s mercy, teaching believers to be persistent in seeking God.

questions.question: According to Deuteronomy 10, what is the significance of the tribe of Levi in relation to the LORD?
options: The LORD is their inheritance; they bear the ark and minister before Him
They receive the largest land inheritance
They are excluded from serving God
They have no special role in Israel
questions.correctAnswer: The LORD is their inheritance; they bear the ark and minister before Him
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 10:8-9 explains that the tribe of Levi is set apart to bear the ark and minister to God, and they have no land inheritance because the LORD Himself is their portion.

hard.title: Deuteronomy Chapter 10 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Deuteronomy Chapter 10.

questions.question: What material was used to make the ark mentioned in Deuteronomy 10, and what is the significance of this choice in the ancient Near Eastern context?
questions.correctAnswer: Shittim wood
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 10:3 specifies that the ark was made of shittim wood, a durable and fragrant wood commonly used in sacred constructions in the ancient Near East, indicating the ark's sanctity and durability.

questions.question: According to Deuteronomy 10, how many days and nights did Moses stay on the mount to receive the second set of tablets, and what is the theological significance of this period?
questions.correctAnswer: 40 days and 40 nights
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 10:10 states Moses stayed for forty days and nights, a period symbolic of testing and divine revelation, also mirrored in other biblical narratives like Jesus' fasting in the wilderness.

questions.question: What is the theological reason given in Deuteronomy 10 for the Levites having no inheritance among their brethren?
options: They were expelled from the land
questions.correctAnswer: The LORD is their inheritance
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 10:9 explains that the Levites have no land inheritance because the LORD Himself is their inheritance, highlighting their special status in service and devotion.

questions.question: Which verse in Deuteronomy 10 commands Israel to 'circumcise the foreskin of your heart' and what does this metaphor signify in the covenant context?
questions.correctAnswer: Deuteronomy 10:16
questions.explanation: Verse 16 uses the metaphor of circumcision of the heart to call for internal repentance and obedience, contrasting external ritual with inward transformation.

questions.question: What requirement does the LORD set for Israel in Deuteronomy 10:12 as a summary of covenant obedience?
options: Fear the LORD, walk in His ways, love Him, and serve Him with all heart and soul
Offer sacrifices daily, observe festivals, and keep the Sabbath
Build altars and appoint judges throughout the land
Gather manna daily and keep the Passover feast
questions.correctAnswer: Fear the LORD, walk in His ways, love Him, and serve Him with all heart and soul
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 10:12 outlines the covenantal response required, emphasizing reverence, obedience, love, and wholehearted service.

questions.question: How does Deuteronomy 10:17 describe the LORD, and what is the significance of these titles in the ancient Near Eastern milieu?
options: God of gods, Lord of lords, a great God, mighty and terrible
King of kings, ruler of rulers, the eternal one
Creator of heaven and earth, the only true God
The compassionate and merciful God of Israel
questions.correctAnswer: God of gods, Lord of lords, a great God, mighty and terrible
questions.explanation: The verse uses exalted titles to assert Yahweh's supremacy over all other deities, a polemic against polytheism common in the ancient Near East.

questions.question: In Deuteronomy 10, who is specifically mentioned as ministering in the priest's office after Aaron's death?
questions.correctAnswer: Eleazar
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 10:6 states that Eleazar, Aaron's son, succeeded him in the priesthood, maintaining the hereditary priestly line.

questions.question: True or False: According to Deuteronomy 10, the LORD gave the children of Israel a land with many rivers called Jotbath.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 10:7 mentions Jotbath as a land of rivers of waters, indicating its geographical richness.

questions.question: According to Deuteronomy 10:18-19, what social justice mandates are given to Israel regarding the vulnerable and foreigners?
options: Execute judgment for orphans and widows, love the stranger, and provide food and clothing
Impose taxes on strangers and orphans
Only assist those of Israelite descent
questions.correctAnswer: Execute judgment for orphans and widows, love the stranger, and provide food and clothing
questions.explanation: These verses emphasize God's concern for justice and mercy, requiring Israel to protect vulnerable groups and welcome strangers as they were once strangers in Egypt.

questions.question: What is the literary function of the phrase 'the LORD thy God requireth of thee' in Deuteronomy 10:12 within the chapter's structure?
options: It serves as a central thematic statement summarizing Israel's covenant responsibilities
It introduces a new commandment unrelated to the previous text
It concludes the book of Deuteronomy
It describes the historical journey of Israel
questions.correctAnswer: It serves as a central thematic statement summarizing Israel's covenant responsibilities
questions.explanation: This phrase encapsulates the chapter's focus on covenant fidelity, acting as a thematic pivot highlighting obedience and love for God.

questions.question: How does Deuteronomy 10:14 emphasize God's sovereignty in creation, and what is the theological implication for Israel's identity?
options: Heaven and earth belong to the LORD, underscoring His universal authority over Israel's God
God is only over Israel and their land
God created only the heavens, not the earth
The earth belongs to the kings of Israel
questions.correctAnswer: Heaven and earth belong to the LORD, underscoring His universal authority over Israel's God
questions.explanation: This verse declares God's ownership of all creation, reinforcing His supreme authority and Israel's place under His dominion.

questions.question: Which phrase in Deuteronomy 10 reflects a typological foreshadowing of the New Testament call for inward transformation?
options: 'Circumcise therefore the foreskin of your heart'
'The LORD separated the tribe of Levi'
'The heavens and the earth belong to the LORD'
questions.correctAnswer: 'Circumcise therefore the foreskin of your heart'
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 10:16 uses the metaphor of circumcision of the heart that anticipates New Testament themes of internal renewal and repentance.

questions.question: What role does the tribe of Levi have according to Deuteronomy 10, and how does this relate to the broader covenant community?
options: To bear the ark, minister before the LORD, and bless in His name
To inherit the largest portion of land
To serve as scribes and judges only
questions.correctAnswer: To bear the ark, minister before the LORD, and bless in His name
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 10:8 assigns Levi a unique priestly role, emphasizing their spiritual function within the covenant people rather than territorial inheritance.

questions.question: Deuteronomy 10:22 compares the increase of Israel to what natural image, and what is the significance of this imagery in biblical theology?
options: Grains of sand on the seashore
questions.correctAnswer: Stars of heaven for multitude
questions.explanation: This metaphor conveys God's blessing of fertility and expansion, a common biblical image signifying covenantal promise and divine favor.

questions.question: True or False: According to Deuteronomy 10, the LORD takes bribes and shows partiality in His judgments.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 10:17 clearly states that the LORD does not regard persons nor take a reward, highlighting His impartial justice.

theological.title: Deuteronomy Chapter 10 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Deuteronomy Chapter 10 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: What did the LORD command Moses to make when He instructed him to hew two tables of stone like the first?
questions.correctAnswer: An ark of wood
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 10:1 states that the LORD told Moses to make an ark of wood to contain the two tables of stone, consistent with Exodus 25:10-22 where the Ark of the Covenant is made as God's dwelling place among His people.

questions.question: What was written on the new tables of stone that Moses hewed?
questions.correctAnswer: The Ten Commandments
questions.explanation: According to Deuteronomy 10:4, the LORD wrote on the tables the Ten Commandments, the same words spoken on the mount from the midst of the fire, affirming God's covenantal law as foundational for Israel, a theme echoed in Exodus 20 and echoed in the New Testament (Romans 13:8-10).

questions.question: Who died and was buried at Mosera during the journey of the children of Israel?
questions.correctAnswer: Aaron
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 10:6 records Aaron's death and burial at Mosera, highlighting the passing of the high priesthood to Eleazar, consistent with Numbers 20:22-29 and Hebrews 7:23-28 emphasizing the priestly succession.

questions.question: Which tribe was separated by the LORD to bear the ark of the covenant and to minister before Him?
questions.correctAnswer: Levi
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 10:8 states that the LORD separated the tribe of Levi to carry the ark and minister before Him, a priestly role established in Numbers 3:5-10 and fulfilled in Christ as the ultimate High Priest (Hebrews 7).

questions.question: Why has the tribe of Levi no inheritance among their brethren?
options: Because the LORD is their inheritance
questions.correctAnswer: Because the LORD is their inheritance
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 10:9 explains Levi has no land inheritance because the LORD Himself is their inheritance, reflecting the spiritual nature of their priestly calling and paralleling God's promises in Joshua 13:33 and Psalm 16:5.

questions.question: How long did Moses stay in the mount the second time when he received the tables?
questions.correctAnswer: Forty days and forty nights
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 10:10 records Moses stayed on the mount forty days and nights, mirroring the first time in Exodus 24:18, symbolizing a divine period of preparation and intercession, prefiguring Christ’s forty days in the wilderness (Matthew 4:1-11).

questions.question: What does the LORD require of Israel according to Deuteronomy 10:12?
options: To fear God, walk in His ways, love Him, and serve Him with all heart and soul
questions.correctAnswer: To fear God, walk in His ways, love Him, and serve Him with all heart and soul
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 10:12 emphasizes the heart of the covenant relationship: fearing God, obedience, love, and wholehearted service, foundational for biblical ethics seen throughout Scripture (Micah 6:8; Matthew 22:37-40).

questions.question: According to Deuteronomy 10:14, what belongs to the LORD?
options: The heaven and the heaven of heavens and the earth with all that is in it
questions.correctAnswer: The heaven and the heaven of heavens and the earth with all that is in it
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 10:14 declares God's sovereign ownership over all creation, a doctrine reinforced in Psalm 24:1 and Colossians 1:16-17, affirming God's transcendence and lordship.

questions.question: What does the LORD call Israel to do with their hearts in verse 16?
options: Circumcise the foreskin of your heart and be no more stiffnecked
questions.correctAnswer: Circumcise the foreskin of your heart and be no more stiffnecked
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 10:16 uses circumcision metaphorically to call for inner spiritual renewal and humility, a theme echoed in Jeremiah 4:4 and Romans 2:29 focusing on inward transformation over mere external rituals.

questions.question: How does Deuteronomy 10:17 describe the LORD your God?
options: God of gods and Lord of lords, great, mighty, terrible, impartial, and not accepting bribes
A God who favors the rich
questions.correctAnswer: God of gods and Lord of lords, great, mighty, terrible, impartial, and not accepting bribes
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 10:17 reveals God's supreme sovereignty and justice, attributes consistent with the Old Testament portrayal (1 Samuel 2:2; Psalm 89:6) and New Testament affirmations of God's impartiality (Acts 10:34-35).

questions.question: What specific acts of justice and mercy does God perform according to Deuteronomy 10:18?
options: Judges the fatherless and widow; loves the stranger by providing food and clothing
questions.correctAnswer: Judges the fatherless and widow; loves the stranger by providing food and clothing
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 10:18 highlights God's concern for the vulnerable and marginalized, consistent with Psalm 68:5, Isaiah 1:17, and Jesus’ teaching on caring for the least (Matthew 25:35-40).

questions.question: Why are the Israelites commanded to love the stranger according to Deuteronomy 10:19?
options: Because they were strangers in the land of Egypt
questions.correctAnswer: Because they were strangers in the land of Egypt
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 10:19 commands love for the stranger grounded in Israel’s own experience as foreigners in Egypt, a theological principle of empathy found also in Leviticus 19:34 and affirmed by Jesus' teaching on neighborly love (Luke 10:25-37).

questions.question: What three actions toward God are commanded in Deuteronomy 10:20?
options: Fear the LORD, serve Him, and cleave to Him
Build altars, offer sacrifices, and chant hymns
Follow the priests, attend festivals, and give offerings
questions.correctAnswer: Fear the LORD, serve Him, and cleave to Him
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 10:20 commands reverence, service, and loyalty to God, reflecting the Shema’s call to love God wholly (Deuteronomy 6:4-5) and the New Testament's call to serve God in spirit and truth (John 4:23-24).

questions.question: What is the reason given in Deuteronomy 10:21 for praising and acknowledging God?
options: He has done great and terrible things seen by the eyes of Israel
He gave them wealth and power
He allowed them to conquer all nations
questions.correctAnswer: He has done great and terrible things seen by the eyes of Israel
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 10:21 highlights God’s mighty deeds as the basis for praise, resonating with Exodus 15:11 and Psalm 77:14, and fulfilled ultimately in Christ’s works (John 2:11).

questions.question: How does Deuteronomy 10:22 describe the growth of the descendants of the fathers who went down into Egypt?
options: Made as numerous as the stars of heaven
questions.correctAnswer: Made as numerous as the stars of heaven
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 10:22 uses the metaphor of stars to describe Israel’s miraculous multiplication, a promise first made to Abraham (Genesis 15:5) and fulfilled as a sign of God's covenant faithfulness, as echoed in Hebrews 11:12.
